meanings.definition: The property of having two different crystal faces in a crystal structure.
meanings.sent1: The hemimorphism of the crystal made it unique among all the others in the collection.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the hemimorphism of the crystal to understand its structure better.
meanings.sent3: The crystal's hemimorphism seemed to give it a playful personality, as if it had two different faces for different occasions.
meanings.sent4: The hemimorphism of the crystal was like having a twin with opposite traits, creating a fascinating symmetry.
meanings.sent5: The hemimorphism of the crystal was so distinct that it could be recognized from afar.

meanings.sent1: The hemimorphism of the mineral was a topic of discussion among geologists.
meanings.sent2: Her research focused on the hemimorphism of certain minerals found in the region.
meanings.sent3: The hemimorphism of the rock formation was so peculiar that it almost seemed intentional.
meanings.sent4: In the world of minerals, the hemimorphism of a specimen can reveal its history like a hidden secret.
meanings.sent5: The hemimorphism of the landscape was a reminder of the Earth's complex and diverse nature.
